channel.title: CVE Feed for Siemens -- Teamcenter V12.4
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Siemens -- Teamcenter V12.4

item.title: CVE-2022-29801|2024-08-03T06:33:42.535Z -- siemens -- teamcenter%20v12.4
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in Teamcenter V12.4 (All versions < V12.4.0.13), Teamcenter V13.0 (All versions < V13.0.0.9). The application contains a XML External Entity Injection (XXE) vulnerability. This could allow an attacker to view files on the application server filesystem.

item.title: CVE-2022-34661|2024-08-03T09:15:15.673Z -- siemens -- teamcenter%20v12.4
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in Teamcenter V12.4 (All versions < V12.4.0.15), Teamcenter V13.0 (All versions < V13.0.0.10), Teamcenter V13.1 (All versions < V13.1.0.10), Teamcenter V13.2 (All versions < V13.2.0.9), Teamcenter V13.3 (All versions < V13.3.0.5), Teamcenter V14.0 (All versions < V14.0.0.2). File Server Cache service in Teamcenter is vulnerable to denial of service by entering infinite loops and using up CPU cycles. This could allow an attacker to cause denial of service condition.

item.title: CVE-2022-34660|2024-08-03T09:15:15.868Z -- siemens -- teamcenter%20v12.4
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in Teamcenter V12.4 (All versions < V12.4.0.15), Teamcenter V13.0 (All versions < V13.0.0.10), Teamcenter V13.1 (All versions < V13.1.0.10), Teamcenter V13.2 (All versions < V13.2.0.9), Teamcenter V13.3 (All versions < V13.3.0.5), Teamcenter V14.0 (All versions < V14.0.0.2). File Server Cache service in Teamcenter consist of a functionality that is vulnerable to command injection. This could potentially allow an attacker to perform remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2022-31619|2024-08-03T07:26:00.834Z -- siemens -- teamcenter%20v12.4
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in Teamcenter V12.4 (All versions < V12.4.0.13), Teamcenter V13.0 (All versions < V13.0.0.9), Teamcenter V13.1 (All versions < V13.1.0.9), Teamcenter V13.2 (All versions < V13.2.0.9), Teamcenter V13.3 (All versions < V13.3.0.3), Teamcenter V14.0 (All versions < V14.0.0.2). Java EE Server Manager HTML Adaptor in Teamcenter consists of default hardcoded credentials. Access to the application allows a user to perform a series of actions that could potentially lead to remote code execution with elevated permissions.

item.title: CVE-2022-24290|2024-08-03T04:07:02.458Z -- siemens -- teamcenter%20v12.4
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in Teamcenter V12.4 (All versions < V12.4.0.13), Teamcenter V13.0 (All versions < V13.0.0.9), Teamcenter V13.1 (All versions), Teamcenter V13.2 (All versions < V13.2.0.8), Teamcenter V13.3 (All versions < V13.3.0.3), Teamcenter V14.0 (All versions < V14.0.0.2). The tcserver.exe binary in affected applications is vulnerable to a stack overflow condition during the parsing of user input that may lead the binary to crash.
